comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The picture shows an Etrich Type VII Renntaube [Renntaube means racing Taube / Dove]. This big 3-seat Taube fitted with an Austro-Daimler 130 hp engine is here seen in the UK before the start of the Daily Mail Circuit of Britain contest (start 22 July 1911). The machine and its pilot (Leutnant Heinrich Bier) were not successful as they became last in the race, due to damage in a forced landing as a result of radiator malfunctioning. The original picture was taken by Flight magazine and published in their issue of 11 November 1911. www.flightglobal.com/pdfarchive/view/1911/1911%20-%200971...
